moderate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
moderate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.

moderate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: having opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, that are not extreme and that most people consider reasonable
moderate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: the more moderate members of the party
moderate.translation[0].definitions[2].d: staying within reasonable or sensible limits
moderate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent
moderate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He learnt to moderate his anger.
moderate.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to do the work of a moderator
